{"step_by_step_thinking": "Excretion is the process of removing waste products from the body, which happens after the drug has been metabolized and used. First order elimination refers to the rate at which the drug is removed from the body, which is not what the question is asking. Metabolism is the process by which the body breaks down and converts medication into usable substances, but this happens after the drug has entered the systemic circulation. The first pass effect, however, refers to the process where the concentration of a drug is greatly reduced before it reaches the systemic circulation. This happens because the drug is metabolized in the liver after being absorbed, but before it enters the bloodstream.", "answer_choice": "B"}
